page.title: 15Drainage system around Mark
page.content: Continued from Page 14 The{rhyne system}takes the water into the main rivers. The 2 main drainage rivers in the area are the{Axe}and the {Brue,}both natural rivers.There is also the{Huntspill River}which was cut during World War 2 to serve as a relief channel for the Brue and to supply the Royal Ordnance Factory at Puriton with several million gallons of water daily. There are several man-made rivers, which take water from the rhynes to the main rivers,chief ones being the{North Drain}in Teadham Moor,the{South Drain}in the Burtle area and the{Mark Yeo}which connects the Axe and Brue flowing through Rooksbridge,Mark (by the White Horse Inn) and Yarrow. The{Wessex Water {Authority}are responsible for the rivers and also charge rates. The rivers discharge into the sea.
